intro: Sogalgina trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed bog plant, is a unique species found in wetland environments. It is characterized by its distinctive trifoliate leaves, which are deeply divided into three lobes. The plant typically grows in shallow, nutrient-poor water or moist soil, adapting to these conditions with specialized root systems. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in loose inflorescences. Sogalgina trilobata plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
